It's a deluded notion of dependent arising.
It's a deluded notion of the characteristics of the body.
When the view of the body is stopped, greed won't arise.
craving then doesn't arise.
Why doesn't he obtain the precepts?
It's because he well sees the range of formations that are produced in the field of sensation.

source_sentence: 云何疑相斷謂不於餘處。
translation: How is the mark of doubt stopped? It means it doesn't arise in other places.
It's the view of the great teacher that arises.
It's purified ...
It's impure.
(Therefore, it's known as the four grave [doubts].
They are all subdued and stopped on the ground.")

source_sentence: 大佛頂首楞嚴經疏解蒙鈔卷第六(之三)
translation: Da foding shoulengyan jing shoujie mengcao roll 6 (no. 3)
